episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and intriguing topics, including the social distancing behavior of sand dunes, a humorous study on the comedic tendencies of people from different regions of England, the dramatic rescue of Mussolini involving a cable car, and the use of a medieval instrument called the "flute of shame" for punishing bad musicians.

facts.fact: Sand dunes are brilliant at social distancing.
According to a recent publication, people from the north of England are more than twice as likely to be naturally funny than people from the south of England.
In 1943, German troops who were rescuing Mussolini had to seize control of a tourist funicular railway so they could ride a cable car to the top of the hill and pick him up.
In medieval Germany, bad musicians were tied to an instrument called the flute of shame.
